cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer.
explanation: The code writes data from 'ptr->data' using 'ptr->data_length' as the size. If 'ptr->data_length' is controlled by an attacker and exceeds the actual allocated size of 'ptr->data', an out-of-bounds read will occur when 'gf_bs_write_data' attempts to access memory beyond the intended buffer. This can lead to information disclosure or a denial of service.

cwe_description: The product reads data past the end of the intended buffer.
explanation: The code uses gf_bs_write_data to write ptr->data_length bytes from ptr->data. If ptr->data_length is derived from untrusted input and exceeds the actual allocated size of the buffer pointed to by ptr->data, an out-of-bounds read will occur. This can lead to information disclosure, denial of service, or potentially arbitrary code execution.
